task.title: Add Corresponding Fields with the Expression Evaluator
task.shortdesc: Use an Expression Editor to add the credit card type fields to the non-credit card stream so all records have the same format when written to the destination.

context.p: To do this, let's use data preview to verify how the Jython Evaluator adds the credit card type to records.

step.cmd: In the pipeline, click the Jython Evaluator to view the output of that processor.
Expand the first output record, scroll down, and expand index 21. Note the header and value information:

info.p: From this, we can see that we need to add a map with an index of 21, as well as the header and value fields.

step.cmd: Add an Expression Evaluator processor to the canvas and connect the second, default stream of the Stream Selector to it.
Click the Add icon twice and configure the properties as follows:
step.info: Each row creates a field: The first creates a map for index 21. The second creates a header field with the name credit_card_type. The third creates a value field that indicates the information is not applicable.

For the last two rows, we're using constants as the last two expressions, so we don't need the dollar sign and brackets for the expression. But if we wanted to use them, we could define them as ${'credit_card_type'} and ${'N/A'}.

step.cmd: Link the Expression Evaluator to the Hadoop FS destination.
